content: This movie felt like the script was written in crayon by someone who just learned how to spell. It’s a mess of random plot points and unrelatable characters. Honestly, it’s like watching a bad reality TV show, but worse.
A completely forgettable experience. The movie is all over the place and tries to be 'deep' but ends up tripping over its own pretensions. I couldn’t decide if I was bored or confused. Spoiler: both.

This movie was like a headache in film form. The acting is stiff, the plot makes no sense, and I can’t even describe how awful the pacing is. Just when I thought it couldn’t get worse, it did. Avoid this at all costs.

This film tried so hard to be quirky and unique, but it ended up being an awkward mess of bad ideas. There were more clichés than I could count, and every scene felt like it was dragging me into a personal nightmare.

The movie thinks it's clever, but it’s just trying too hard. It had potential at the beginning, but quickly became a string of eye-roll moments. If you love movies that miss the mark but still think they're profound, this is for you.
If this movie were a dish, it would be undercooked, bland, and way too salty. There’s no real plot or character development just a lot of wasted potential and missed opportunities.

I’m still not sure what I watched. It’s like the director found a bunch of random scenes on YouTube and thought, 'Yeah, this will work.' It’s a jumbled mess with no direction and zero payoff. Painful.

The movie tried to create drama, but the only thing that actually got dramatic was my level of boredom. There were no twists, no suspense, just a string of awkward moments and bad decisions. You’ve been warned.

This movie clearly thought it was a lot smarter than it was. The script was full of forced dialogue, the plot was practically non-existent, and the acting was just painful to watch. How did this even get made?

Watching this movie felt like punishment. Every time I thought it couldn’t get worse, it did. It’s like the filmmakers set out to create the most obnoxious and frustrating movie ever and they succeeded.

This movie felt like it was trying to be profound but ended up being a mess of incoherent thoughts and random explosions. The script was so bad, even the actors seemed confused about what was going on.

I get that movies are supposed to be an escape, but this was more like a test of endurance. There were so many missed opportunities, and the pacing was so slow that I almost started rooting for the villain just for some excitement.

The plot felt like it was written on a napkin in a bar at 2 AM. There was no cohesion, no consistency, and no reason to care about any of the characters. It tried to be emotional, but I just felt annoyed.
This movie had the emotional depth of a puddle. The characters were one-dimensional, the plot made no sense, and the ending was so predictable that I started guessing the credits halfway through.

I can’t tell if this movie was supposed to be a satire or if it was just poorly made. Either way, it was full of clichés, unfunny jokes, and too many awkward pauses. I laughed, but not for the reasons they intended.
The acting was so wooden that I half expected the characters to start sprouting branches. The plot was equally stiff and lifeless, making it a struggle to stay engaged.

I’ve watched paint dry more exciting than this. The plot was a mess, the characters had the depth of a cardboard cutout, and the special effects were laughable. Do yourself a favor and skip this disaster.
I kept waiting for something to happen, but every scene dragged on like a bad first date. The pacing was horrible, and the characters had no chemistry. A huge letdown.
There’s ‘so bad it’s good,’ and then there’s this. It’s bad, but there’s nothing enjoyable about it. Just pure, unadulterated confusion from beginning to end. I almost walked out halfway through.
This movie could have been a great thriller, but instead, it was a boring, drawn-out snooze fest. The story was all over the place, and it never delivered on its potential.

This movie felt like a fever dream if that dream was written by someone with zero storytelling skills. Every scene was a masterclass in confusion. I kept watching in hope, but the credits rolled and so did my sanity.
Somehow the trailer managed to hide the fact that nothing actually happens in this movie. It's like the film was allergic to plot and character development. I'm still unsure what I watched, or why.
Imagine someone adapting a broken printer into a screenplay that's this movie. It spits out nonsense, breaks midway through, and you're just left watching sparks and smoke.
The acting is wooden, the dialogue is sawdust, and the story should be chopped down entirely. Every time someone spoke, I questioned my life choices. Painfully unwatchable.
This wasn't just bad it was aggressively bad. Like it woke up every morning and chose violence against cinema. It should come with a warning label and a refund coupon.
I wanted to turn it off, but I was too fascinated by how consistently terrible every decision was. It's rare to see a movie fail this evenly across every department.
Watching this movie was like running a marathon with no shoes and no water, only to discover the finish line is just a mirror showing your disappointed face.
The plot was thinner than the toilet paper at a gas station. Characters pop in and out like confused NPCs in a broken video game. I wouldn't wish this film on my worst enemy.
They could’ve made this movie shorter by just never making it. Every scene added nothing, and somehow still managed to overstay its welcome. Absolute cinematic quicksand.
I’ve never seen a film try so hard and achieve so little. It’s like watching someone juggle spaghetti messy, sad, and strangely hypnotic.
This movie was like a magic trick except the only thing that disappeared was my patience. Not even entertaining in a 'so bad it's good' way. Just... bad.
Every character acted like they were in a completely different movie. The plot wandered off early and never came back. A total mess from start to finish.
It’s the kind of film that makes you check the runtime every five minutes, just to suffer the realization you’re only ten minutes in. Time slowed down. Painfully.
If a group of cats wrote a screenplay while fighting over a laser pointer, it would still be more coherent than this. A true test of patience.
You know a movie’s bad when your snacks are the only thing keeping you invested. I finished the popcorn in 15 minutes, and the movie never recovered.
A baffling mix of nothing happening and too much happening all at once. Like watching a blender full of tropes and clichés with the lid off.
The movie opened strong by which I mean I was still awake. But by the halfway mark I was rooting for the credits to roll. Brutal.
You know it's bad when you start analyzing the background props just to stay entertained. I noticed a typo on a newspaper and that was the highlight.
There’s bad, then there’s this movie. I’m not even mad it’s impressive how committed it is to mediocrity. Like a masterclass in creative surrender.
It felt like the movie was punishing me for something. Every minute stretched into an eternity. I left the theater older, sadder, and slightly dehydrated.
This movie had all the suspense of a soggy paper towel. I kept waiting for something anything to happen, but it was like watching a slideshow of disappointment.
It felt like a group project where nobody cared and everyone just guessed what a movie is supposed to be. The result? An absolute dumpster fire with a soundtrack.
The only thing scary about this film is how it got funded. I’ve seen more character development in microwave instructions.
This wasn’t a movie. This was a cautionary tale about what happens when no one says 'maybe we shouldn't.' Truly baffling from start to finish.
The plot holes are so massive I’m surprised no one fell in and disappeared. It's like the script was written by playing Mad Libs with a blender.
It started like it had promise, then immediately nose-dived into a pit of poor choices and bad dialogue. A cinematic black hole of entertainment.
If awkward pacing and confusing motives were a genre, this movie would be the gold standard. I laughed once, but it was a cry for help.
The movie tries to be deep, but ends up drowning in its own shallow ideas. I’ve had more compelling conversations with a vending machine.
A two-hour long shrug. Nobody looks like they want to be in this film, including me, the viewer. It’s not just bad, it’s aggressively bland.
Honestly, the best part was the credits because they meant it was over. This movie should be studied as a psychological endurance test.
This movie has the pacing of a snail on sedatives. Scenes drag on like a group chat that refuses to end. Avoid unless you need a nap.
It's one of those films where the title is the most creative part. The rest is just a confusing, slow spiral into cinematic despair.
The film tries to make bold statements but can’t even form a coherent sentence. It’s like watching someone lose an argument to themselves for two hours.
This wasn’t a rollercoaster. It was an elevator stuck between floors claustrophobic, annoying, and entirely pointless. A spectacular waste of cast and crew.
A cinematic vacuum loud, directionless, and it somehow sucked all the joy out of the room. Nothing sticks, not even the jokes.
The only thing more lifeless than this plot was the cast’s delivery. It felt like watching cardboard act out an email thread.
It’s not often you watch something that’s both overcomplicated and boring, but here we are. Like reading a textbook printed in Comic Sans.
It’s almost impressive how every interesting idea gets buried under clichés. I kept hoping for a twist, but the biggest twist was I didn’t walk out.
From the first minute, you know exactly where it’s going and it still manages to disappoint. Predictable, plodding, and painfully dull.
The movie set up a mystery, then forgot what it was doing. Like being promised cake and handed a wet napkin. Just... why?
This film has the energy of a reheated dinner technically complete, but limp and joyless. I've seen more dramatic tension in a group project status update.
If boredom had a director, this would be their magnum opus. It's two hours of plotless wandering and actors who seem just as confused as I was.
Every scene feels like the movie paused to remember what it was doing. The pacing? Glacial. The story? Missing. The experience? Unforgettable in the worst way.
This wasn't a story it was an extended sigh. Characters wandered through scenes like they were lost in a mall. It ended, mercifully, but not soon enough.
This movie made me question how I spend my time. I've accidentally watched livestreams of paint drying that had more narrative momentum than this.
It’s the cinematic equivalent of trying to assemble IKEA furniture with no instructions and missing half the parts. And somehow it still manages to wobble.
The script sounds like it was written by predictive text. Characters say things no human would say, in situations no human would be in. Hilariously bad.
The film feels like it’s punishing you for paying attention. The more you focus, the less sense it makes. A surreal exercise in confusion.
This wasn’t so much a movie as a very expensive mistake. The plot crawls like a wounded raccoon and ends just as unceremoniously. Avoid at all costs.
Imagine trying to retell a dream you barely remember while being attacked by clichés that’s this film. A total narrative disaster dressed in expensive lighting.
Not even bad in an entertaining way just bad. It’s like the director filmed a rehearsal and thought, ‘Yeah, good enough.’ Spoiler: It wasn’t.
I can’t decide what was worse the acting or the dialogue. It's like someone fed a soap opera to a paper shredder and filmed what fell out.
This movie doesn't just miss the mark it misses the whole target range. A nonsensical parade of awkward cuts, weird tone shifts, and confused characters.
The film throws plot twists at you like spaghetti at a wall nothing sticks, everything’s a mess. Not even bad enough to be memorable.
A chaotic blend of nothingness. Characters arrive, say things that make no sense, then disappear like plot ghosts. It’s impressive how incoherent this is.
I don’t know what they were trying to say, but they said it very badly and for way too long. It’s like watching someone read a confused tweet thread out loud.
A stunning achievement in misdirection. Just when you think it’s going somewhere, it swerves into nonsense and stays there. It's like watching GPS fail in real time.
Not sure what the worst part was the acting, the editing, or the fact that I watched the whole thing hoping it would get better. It did not.
Like a failed school play with a big budget. Everyone involved looks embarrassed, and now I share that feeling. Cinematic misfire of the year.
This film should come with a free therapist. I laughed, I cried, I regretted every minute. Truly an emotional rollercoaster of disappointment.
